intro: Sisymbrium hieraciifolium, commonly known as the hoary brookweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and small white or yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along streambanks and roadside areas. Sisymbrium hieraciifolium is an annual herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting pollinator populations.
